<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return a copy of the specified basic block, but without</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// embedding the block into a particular function.  The block returned is an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exact copy of the specified basic block, without any remapping having been</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// performed.  Because of this, this is only suitable for applications where</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the basic block will be inserted into the same function that it was cloned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from (loop unrolling would use this, for example).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Also, note that this function makes a direct copy of the basic block, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// can thus produce illegal LLVM code.  In particular, it will copy any PHI</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">/// nodes from the original block, even though there are no predecessors for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// newly cloned block (thus, phi nodes will have to be updated).  Also, this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block will branch to the old successors of the original block: these</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// successors will have to have any PHI nodes updated to account for the new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// incoming edges.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The correlation between instructions in the source and result basic blocks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is recorded in the VMap map.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If you have a particular suffix you&#39;d like to use to add to any cloned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">/// names, specify it as the optional third parameter.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If you would like the basic block to be auto-inserted into the end of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function, you can specify it as the optional fourth parameter.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If you would like to collect additional information about the cloned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function, you can specify a ClonedCodeInfo object with the optional fifth</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// parameter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa1c8d384f90fc9d69d7fcdf920138cf2">CloneBasicBlock</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BasicBlock &#42;BB, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VMap,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return a copy of the specified function and add it to that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function&#39;s module.  Also, any references specified in the VMap are changed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to refer to their mapped value instead of the original one.  If any of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">/// arguments to the function are in the VMap, the arguments are deleted from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the resultant function.  The VMap is updated to include mappings from all of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the instructions and basicblocks in the function from their old to new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">/// values.  The final argument captures information about the cloned code if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// non-null.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\pre VMap contains no non-identity GlobalValue mappings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">Function &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aedeb89fa4ceb608d9d49bcd53ddcd2c1">CloneFunction</a>(Function &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VMap,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Clone OldFunc into NewFunc, transforming the old arguments into references</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to VMap values.  Note that if NewFunc already has basic blocks, the ones</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cloned into it will be added to the end of the function.  This function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">/// fills in a list of return instructions, and can optionally remap types</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and/or append the specified suffix to all values cloned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p Changes is \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::LocalChangesOnly, VMap is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// required to contain no non-identity GlobalValue mappings. Otherwise,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">/// referenced metadata will be cloned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p Changes is less than \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::DifferentModule</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// indicating cloning into the same module (even if it&#39;s LocalChangesOnly), if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">/// debug info metadata transitively references a \\a DISubprogram, it will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cloned, effectively upgrading \\p Changes to GlobalChanges while suppressing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cloning of types and compile units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If \\p Changes is \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::DifferentModule, the new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">/// module&#39;s \\c !llvm.dbg.cu will get updated with any newly created compile</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="comment">/// units. (\\a CloneFunctionChangeType::ClonedModule leaves that work for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="comment">/// caller.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">/// FIXME: Consider simplifying this function by splitting out \\a</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This works exactly like CloneFunctionInto,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">/// except that it does some simple constant prop and DCE on the fly.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">/// effect of this is to copy significantly less code in cases where (for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="comment">/// example) a function call with constant arguments is inlined, and those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="comment">/// constant arguments cause a significant amount of code in the callee to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">/// dead.  Since this doesn&#39;t produce an exactly copy of the input, it can&#39;t be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="comment">/// used for things like CloneFunction or CloneModule.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If ModuleLevelChanges is false, VMap contains no non-identity GlobalValue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="comment">/// mappings.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7a6386c071e1087512cdc8a4071a02b5">CloneAndPruneFunctionInto</a>(Function &#42;NewFunc, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Function &#42;OldFunc,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal">                               <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VMap, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ModuleLevelChanges,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal">                               SmallVectorImpl&lt;ReturnInst&#42;&gt; &amp;Returns,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal">                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;NameSuffix = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Collect debug information such as types, compile units, and other</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subprograms that are reachable from \\p F and can be considered global for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the purposes of cloning (and hence not needing to be cloned).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="comment">/// What debug information should be processed depends on \\p Changes: when</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cloning into the same module we process \\p F&#39;s subprogram and instructions;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">/// when into a cloned module, neither of those.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns DISubprogram of the cloned function when cloning into the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">/// module or nullptr otherwise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal">DISubprogram &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad9d4e85b3abfbf1a3dd8a7fd45057cce">CollectDebugInfoForCloning</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Function &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abe00617fc34ceb1aa0eb62995732b30a">CloneFunctionChangeType</a> Changes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         DebugInfoFinder &amp;DIFinder);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Based on \\p Changes and \\p DIFinder return debug info that needs to be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">/// identity mapped during Metadata cloning.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: Such \\a MetadataSetTy can be used by \\a CloneFunction&#42; to directly</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="comment">/// specify metadata that should be identity mapped (and hence not cloned). The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="comment">/// metadata will be identity mapped in \\a ValueToValueMapTy on first use. There</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are several reasons for doing it this way rather than eagerly identity</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="comment">/// mapping metadata nodes in a \\a ValueMap:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1 Mapping metadata is not cheap, particularly because of tracking.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2 When cloning a Function we identity map lots of global module-level</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">///    metadata to avoid cloning it, while only a fraction of it is actually</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">///    used by the function. Mapping on first use is a lot faster for modules</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">///    with meaningful amount of debug info.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3 Eagerly identity mapping metadata makes it harder to cache module-level</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="comment">///    data (e.g. a set of metadata nodes in a \\a DICompileUnit).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a91897d2d0da113b016f14ae110586ab1">MetadataSetTy</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a954c742913f42266852b86ca04547929">FindDebugInfoToIdentityMap</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abe00617fc34ceb1aa0eb62995732b30a">CloneFunctionChangeType</a> Changes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         DebugInfoFinder &amp;DIFinder,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         DISubprogram &#42;SPClonedWithinModule);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class captures the data input to the InlineFunction call, and records</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function inlines the called function into the basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block of the caller.  This returns false if it is not possible to inline</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this call.  The program is still in a well defined state if this occurs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">/// though.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that this only does one level of inlining.  For example, if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction &#39;call B&#39; is inlined, and &#39;B&#39; calls &#39;C&#39;, then the call to &#39;C&#39; now</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="comment">/// exists in the instruction stream.  Similarly this will inline a recursive</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function by one level.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that while this routine is allowed to cleanup and optimize the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42;inlined&#42; code to minimize the actual inserted code, it must not delete</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="comment">/// code in the caller as users of this routine may have pointers to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions in the caller that need to remain stable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If ForwardVarArgsTo is passed, inlining a function with varargs is allowed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and all varargs at the callsite will be passed to any calls to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ForwardVarArgsTo. The caller of InlineFunction has to make sure any varargs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are only used by ForwardVarArgsTo.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The callee&#39;s function attributes are merged into the callers&#39; if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MergeAttributes is set to true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">InlineResult <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab5a3ac0a249da0743dac1bd816d8e5d5">InlineFunction</a>(CallBase &amp;CB, InlineFunctionInfo &amp;IFI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MergeAttributes = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">                            AAResults &#42;CalleeAAR = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> InsertLifetime = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">                            Function &#42;ForwardVarArgsTo = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Same as above, but it will update the contextual profile. If the contextual</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">/// profile is invalid (i.e. not loaded because it is not present), it defaults</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">InlineResult <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab5a3ac0a249da0743dac1bd816d8e5d5">InlineFunction</a>(CallBase &amp;CB, InlineFunctionInfo &amp;IFI,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Clones a loop \\p OrigLoop.  Returns the loop and the blocks in \\p</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Blocks.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Updates LoopInfo and DominatorTree assuming the loop is dominated by block</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\p LoopDomBB.  Insert the new blocks before block specified in \\p Before.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal">Loop &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6f244e1d6d34701da1f29d3a762974fd">cloneLoopWithPreheader</a>(BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/passes/standardinstrumentations-cpp/#a6f1bbcae7288f05872dcfe811d0388baa9060587edeb01a63e3d3edc959678d1e">Before</a>, BasicBlock &#42;LoopDomBB,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Remaps instructions in \\p Blocks using the mapping in \\p VMap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab8ec5c940fbc440c992716fbe4a48636">remapInstructionsInBlocks</a>(ArrayRef&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; Blocks,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal">                               <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;VMap);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Split edge between BB and PredBB and duplicate all non-Phi instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="comment">/// from BB between its beginning and the StopAt instruction into the split</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block. Phi nodes are not duplicated, but their uses are handled correctly:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="comment">/// we replace them with the uses of corresponding Phi inputs. ValueMapping</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is used to map the original instructions from BB to their newly-created</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="comment">/// copies. Returns the split block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="normal">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4cd89ca702a817aac3a4521dd2462a2e">DuplicateInstructionsInSplitBetween</a>(BasicBlock &#42;BB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                BasicBlock &#42;PredBB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                Instruction &#42;StopAt,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abf0f52ae29f87b5e0f2b95ff961cdae1">ValueToValueMapTy</a> &amp;ValueMapping,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                DomTreeUpdater &amp;DTU);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Updates profile information by adjusting the entry count by adding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="comment">/// EntryDelta then scaling callsite information by the new count divided by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
